Bricktech,"2014-09-08T01:14:32.843Z","The Ultimate PF Motor","

The best PF motor, but also one of
Packaged in a small bag, like all PF products.
This has the RPM of an M-motor and
column2: half the torque of a XL-motor. This gives you far more flexibility than a XL-motor, because you can adjust the speed using gears (XL-motors have 220 RPM, M and L motors have 380 RPM). &nbsp

column1: This Motor is also *almost* the same size as a M-motor (L is 7 studs long, M is 6), but is FAR easier to fit into a technic MOC, because it has way more connection points.

column2: t like about this Motor is that it&#39
column3: s almost twice the price of an M-motor, at $13.99.&nbsp

column1:
,TRUE,5,5,5,5,4 Sarang","2017-02-14T07:18:13.017Z","Great Motor for Technic builders","

The L-motor occupies a position between the M and the XL motors due to its overall specifications and is preferred over the smaller m-motor by Technic builders.
It is a single stud longer than the m-motor but has '
It has more attachment points than the m motor but lacks any system connections. This makes it easier to integrate into Technic builds than the m-motor.
The m-motor has a higher RPM than the l-motor making it a bit slower. But when it comes to torque the l-motor is better than the m-motor.
The L-motor is ideally placed when it comes to specs but it'
column2: s price a sticking point for some people.
